caption.p: Clinical manifestations and lesions in viral equine encephalitis. Horses infected with equine encephalitis viruses may experience posture deficits (increasing of the lift polygon in ( a)), cranial nerve deficits (facial paralysis in ( b)), balance deficiencies (slings in ( c) can be used to support paretic horses and avoid long and poor prognosis recumbency). Brain lesions are non-specific and include perivascular infiltration of inflammatory cells, observed in ( d). Credits: Pr Agn√®s Leblond, VetAgroSup, and Dr Eve Laloy, French Veterinary School of Alfort.
